header.title: Frequently Asked Questions
header.description: Find answers to the most common questions about MobiFit.

questions.question: What is MobiFit?
questions.answer: MobiFit is a SuperApp for workouts with videos and instructions created by professionals. You can create your own workouts, use the available ones, receive from a professional, or use plans generated by the integrated AI. The app also brings gamification, with points, medals, and groups for challenges and interaction.

questions.question: In which languages is the app available?
questions.answer: MobiFit is available in three languages: English, Portuguese, and Spanish.

questions.question: Do I need to create an account to use the app?
questions.answer: It's not mandatory for workouts. You can start using most features without logging in. Authentication is only required for features like groups and cloud data synchronization.

questions.question: Does the app work offline?
questions.answer: Yes. Data is stored locally on the device, allowing you to use the exercise library, workouts, record progress, and access your points even without internet connection. Media parts, such as execution images and videos, are available offline only if they have been viewed previously.

questions.question: How does AI work in MobiFit?
questions.answer: AI creates personalized workout plans based on your request, answers questions about exercises, and offers adaptations according to your level, goal, or available equipment. It also learns your level and preferences with use, improving suggestions over time.

questions.question: Do I need to know how to create prompts to use AI?
questions.answer: No. The app has an option called "Create Workout" that collects your preferences and automatically generates the ideal request for you.

questions.question: Are videos generated by AI?
questions.answer: No. All videos and instructions were created by human professionals. They serve only to illustrate movements and may show different equipment than indicated in the exercise title.

questions.question: What's the difference between the "MobiFit Workouts" and "My Workouts" menus?
questions.answer: MobiFit Workouts are ready-made workouts created by professionals specifically for the app, organized by difficulty level and generic. "My Workouts" are exclusive to the user, and can be created manually, by AI, or received from others, like friends and professionals.

questions.question: How does the workout structure work?
questions.answer: The hierarchy is: Plan → Workouts → Exercises. A plan brings together several workouts, and each workout contains a sequence of specific exercises.

questions.question: Can I create my own exercises?
questions.answer: Yes. You can create custom exercises, including name, description, YouTube video URL, and your own image. To upload images, you need to log in.

questions.question: How do I share a workout with someone else?
questions.answer: To share a workout, both need to be in the same group. You can share directly with a specific person in the group or make the workout available to all group members.

questions.question: When should I use "Register Activity"?
questions.answer: Use register activity when you perform exercises that are not available in the saved Workouts. At the end, you can optionally share in a MobiFit group and/or Instagram Stories.

questions.question: What are Goals?
questions.answer: Goals are personal and have a duration defined by you. Check-in is done by marking a workout as completed or manually in the Goals menu.

questions.question: Video registering Goals
Do I need to log in to participate in groups?
questions.answer: Yes. The groups feature requires authentication.

questions.question: How do I join a group?
questions.answer: You can click on the invitation link received or use the "join a group" option and enter the provided code.

questions.question: What can administrators do in groups?
questions.answer: Administrators can manage members, view submitted anamneses, and share workouts with the entire group.

questions.question: What are Challenges?
questions.answer: Challenges are group-based, with check-ins made by posting. They can have a defined period or be continuous.

questions.question: Demonstration video of challenges
How does the check-in system work in challenges?
questions.answer: You can check-in in two ways: posting directly to the group feed or when completing a workout use the option to share in the group. Each post counts as a check-in.

questions.question: How is the ranking calculated in challenges?
questions.answer: The ranking can be viewed by "active days" or "total check-ins". If you make two posts on the same day, they will be two check-ins, but only one active day.

questions.question: How to create and configure challenges to engage students?
questions.answer: As a group administrator, access the settings and activate the challenge option. Define the start and end date of the period you want to monitor. You can also check the option to require a photo for posting, making it mandatory for students to send images in check-ins, ensuring greater commitment.

questions.question: How do coins work?
questions.answer: Practically every relevant action in the app earns coins, encouraging engagement and consistency in workouts.

questions.question: What are medals?
questions.answer: Medals mark specific achievements, such as starting a goal, joining a group, or completing certain objectives.

questions.question: Is there ranking in the app?
questions.answer: Yes. In group challenges, there is a ranking system based on members' check-ins, which can be filtered by different periods.

questions.question: Can I share my complete workout on social media?
questions.answer: Yes. When completing a workout or registering an activity, you can post to the internal group and also to Instagram Stories, with custom sticker options.

questions.question: How does photo sharing work?
questions.answer: The sharing modal allows you to take photos or choose from the gallery. You can post only to the MobiFit group, Instagram Stories, or both. Vertical photos are automatically cropped to 4:5 for the group feed, but go uncropped on Instagram Stories. The app shows the crop at the time of capture.

questions.question: Are my data saved if I haven't registered?
questions.answer: Yes. Data remains stored locally on your device. However, without login, they are not synchronized to the cloud and may be lost if you uninstall the app or lose the device.

questions.question: How can MobiFit help with my work with students?
questions.answer: The app offers specific resources for professionals: you can create private groups for your students, share personalized workouts, monitor engagement through challenges, and receive anamnesis information in an organized and private way.

questions.question: How does workout sharing with students work?
questions.answer: You can share a personalized workout with all members of a group or send it directly to a specific student. When the workout is shared with the group, it appears in the "Workouts" menu within the group, and each student can add it manually to their list in "My Workouts". If the workout is sent directly to a student, it appears automatically in their app, in "My Workouts", in the "Content" tab.

questions.question: Do I need to be in the same group as my student to share workouts?
questions.answer: Yes. All interactive parts of the app use groups. Workout sharing is only possible between people in the same group. You must create a group, send the invitation link to your students, and after they join, you can share workouts.

questions.question: What is anamnesis and how to use it with my students?
questions.answer: Anamnesis is a space where your students can send relevant personal information for monitoring. This data is visible exclusively to group administrators, allowing you to maintain an organized history of each student, with information about health, goals, limitations, and other important observations for workout prescription.

questions.question: How to monitor student performance in challenges?
questions.answer: In the group ranking menu, you view the participation of all members. The system allows switching between viewing by active days or total check-ins, in addition to filtering by different periods: current week, month, year, or always. A progress bar shows the progress of the challenge in relation to the total defined period.

questions.question: Can I have multiple groups for different student classes?
questions.answer: Yes. You can create and administer multiple groups, each with their own settings, challenges, and shared workouts.
